job_title: Assistant Professor in Holly Springs, MS
pros: relative freedom in curriculum selection; hours somewhat more flexoble than corporate environment
cons: students are not prepared a high academic standing is not expressedly expected. reportkeeping to protect faculty decisions is demotivating to work environment. pressure for grade inflation exists because the college will close if too many students fail. many students appear to be in college to get cash from government rather than be focused on acquiring educational or critical thinking skills. Exiting academic dean destroyed my joy of teaching at this college because he did not perform according to his responsibilities and did not support the faculty. Remained as academic dean due to nepotism..

job_title: Assistant Professor in Holly Springs, MS
pros: small class sizes; students are generally polite
cons: no opportunity for intellectual growth; enrollment criteria gets unmotivated students; pressure for grade inflation; no opportunity for intellectual growth; administration focused on chaining activities of faculty so all creativity is stifled. Students do not get value for education placement history is terrible. motivated students could get all their hiring skills simply by going online. Faculty are discouraged from challenging students.

pros: A good HBCU and the cost to attend is low
cons: Employee benefits and salaries are low
